channel.title: BBC News
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see https://www.bbc.co.uk/usingthebbc/terms-of-use/#15metadataandrssfeeds for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Pupils 'appear to have been forgotten' in merger of three schools
item.description: Causeway Academy is a new integrated school which is a merger of three existing north coast schools.

item.title: 'Significant' blaze at recycling centre put out
item.description: The fire service described it as a "significant incident" at a centre near the Ballygomartin Road.

item.title: 'Toxic thunderdome' assembly urged to back proposed environment agency
item.description: Andrew Muir says assembly members should "put their money where their mouth is" and support the plan for an independent environment agency.

item.title: Pregnant officer feared drive-by shooting after data breach
item.description: The High Court has begun hearing from people impacted by the major data breach by the Police Service of Northern Ireland (PSNI).

item.title: Security alert after suspicious object found in west Belfast
item.description: Cordons are in place in the Suffolk Road in west Belfast.

item.title: A good upstart: Feargal Sharkey talks protesting, polls and border smuggling
item.description: Feargal Sharkey appears in the latest edition of the Borderland - UK or United Ireland? podcast which focuses on campaigning.

item.title: BBC NI presenters in three-legged challenge for Children In Need
item.description: Connor Phillips and Cate Conway are leading a 25 mile walk from Portadown to Newry which began on Tuesday.

item.title: Man killed 'well known' in village, says MP
item.description: Jordan Webb, 28, was pronounced dead at the scene in Portavogie on Monday morning.

item.title: Scheme tackling violence against women with young footballers
item.description: The 'Fair Game' initiative is being run by the Irish Football Association in collaboration with Women's Aid and the police service.

item.title: The County Clare lion which was actually a 'Mouse'
item.description: A video of what was thought to be a lion was posted on social media and a report was made to Gardaí (Irish police) on 29 October.

item.title: Man killed in suspected hit-and-run was retired teacher
item.description: Patrick Flanagan, 69, died in hospital after being found injured in Dungiven in the early hours of Sunday morning.

item.title: 'Callous' amendment to include abortions in baby loss certificates defeated
item.description: The amendment which was described as "callous", by an Alliance MLA, received 53 no votes to 23 yeses.

item.title: Details of Translink late-night buses pilot announced
item.description: The pilot scheme will begin on 28 November 2025 with late-night buses running on Friday and Saturday evenings.

item.title: Students flock to pet animals for their mental health
item.description: As part of a week of activities to help students with their mental health, a students' union have arranged for animals to come to the campus

item.title: IOM TT record-breaker Dunlop receives MBE from King
item.description: Michael Dunlop, who holds the record for the most number of Isle of Man TT wins with 33, receives his MBE from King Charles in a ceremony at Windsor Castle.

item.title: Businessman asked if he was 'a little too trusting' in fraud case
item.description: Businessmen Ian Coulter and Frank Cushnahan deny the charges against them.

item.title: Farmers should be very concerned as thousands of poultry set to be culled
item.description: A government veterinary officer says "we are now in the higher risk period of avian influenza".

item.title: PSNI would come to a 'stop' if strike happens, claims union
item.description: The trade union NIPSA has said it plans to ballot around 1,600 police workers for strike action.

item.title: More than 100 children married during wait to raise minimum age to 18
item.description: It is legal for 16 and 17-year-olds in Northern Ireland to marry, unlike in England, Wales and the Republic of Ireland.

item.title: Dullest October in a century recorded in Northern Ireland
item.description: Data shows there was a boom in gloom, with just 41% average sunshine recorded across the month.

item.title: 'Just because I'm disabled, why can't I drive what I want?'
item.description: Farah Black is one of more than 50,000 people in Northern Ireland who uses Motability scheme.

item.title: Lucy Liu star of the show at Belfast Film Festival
item.description: The star shares her memories of a month filming in Northern Ireland and her fondness for local food.

item.title: Missing murder victims' families give each other strength, says sister
item.description: Columba McVeigh's sister praises the solidarity and strength of Families of the Disappeared at annual memorial at Stormont.

item.title: Interconnector row rumbles on as pylons 'walk over the will of the people'
item.description: A County Armagh resident says people remain opposed to the decades-delayed north-south interconnector.

item.title: Politician dances with the devil as new play gets a little Faust-ish
item.description: The play tells the classic tale of the Faust legend through the lens of a Northern Ireland MLA.

item.title: BBC Newsline signed summary
item.description: A signed summary of BBC Newsline.

item.title: A man, his dog and a big jog: The duo driving 2,500 miles for sporting glory
item.description: Matthew Milliken and his teammate Dizzy are packing the campervan for the Czech Republic to take part in a cross-country running event with a canine twist.

item.title: Firms listed on 'weird' website with wrong information fear reputation hit
item.description: BBC News NI also speaks to businesses in other areas of the UK whose businesses were also listed without their permission.

item.title: Your questions answered on the long delayed north-south power project
item.description: Your questions answered on the €350m (£308m) scheme first proposed in 2006.

item.title: 'Arthritis, a stroke and PTSD - Tai Chi and martial arts help me deal with it all'
item.description: Richard Brown helped organise Ireland's first Chinese Traditional Cultural Exchange Festival, which is on in Belfast until Sunday.

item.title: Number of Irish citizens deported from US rises by more than 50%
item.description: New figures show more Irish citizens are being deported from the US, amid a crackdown by immigration officials.

item.title: 'Speaking Irish is everything' - Belfast hosts thousands for language festival
item.description: Thousands from across the island and beyond came together in Belfast for Oireachtas na Samhna, Ireland's oldest Irish language gathering.

item.title: Children taught 'not to judge' in hate crime play
item.description: The teenagers hope that the children who watch their play will educate the adults in their lives about hate crime.

item.title: 'Back to the roots' of Halloween
item.description: Halloween has been celebrated in Ireland in one form or another for more than 2,000 years.

item.title: Homes v retail balance warning over town centre regeneration
item.description: Plans for Scotch Street in Dungannon have divided opinion over the balance of commercial properties and housing.

item.title: 'Day of madness' as pupils turn town into Halloween carnival
item.description: The annual parade of pupils from Primate Dixon Primary School involves about 1,000 people.

item.title: Education bursary 'gives you that incentive to go on'
item.description: Young people from Belfast say getting a bursary to put towards their education will really help.

item.title: Soldier F prosecution not 'vexatious', says Benn
item.description: The secretary of state said there are "no vexatious prosecutions" while answering questions about the decision to prosecute Soldier F.

item.title: Birds culled, control zones introduced after suspected bird flu case
item.description: Agriculture Minister Andrew Muir says disease control measures were introduced as a "precautionary measure"

item.title: Man in his 60s dies after suspected hit and run
item.description: Police appeal for information after an injured man is found in the Foreglen Road area of Dungiven, County Londonderry, on Sunday.

item.title: Kilrea Bridge work to take 'longer' than anticipated
item.description: The Kilrea Bridge has been closed since September after extensive cracking was discovered in a retaining wall.

item.title: Thousands witness climax of Europe's biggest Halloween carnival
item.description: It is thought more than 100,000 people have taken part in Derry's Halloween festivities this year.

item.title: Reaction to Soldier F trial costs branded a 'double standard'
item.description: David Johnstone says he found it "incredulous that there is this level of point scoring" following the trial.

item.title: Civil service recruiting 200 people in north west
item.description: Successful applicants will take up roles across different Northern Ireland Executive departments.

item.title: Everything you need to know about Europe's biggest Halloween party
item.description: Billed by organisers as the largest Halloween event in Europe, the four-day festival gets under way on Tuesday.

item.title: Police car windscreen smashed by youths
item.description: Police say they believe three incidents in Strabane, including the smashing of a police car windscreen, are linked.

item.title: No bathing at Portstewart Strand after blue-green algae found on beach
item.description: A "significant" amount of blue-green algae scum is detected in the water and also on the beach.

item.title: Businesses feel 'hung out to dry' over bridge closure
item.description: The Kilrea Bridge has been closed since last month after extensive cracking was discovered in a retaining wall.

item.title: Viable device found during security alert
item.description: Police say the device, which was left at in a residential property, posed a serious risk to the local community.

item.title: Lincoln City fined over James McClean sectarian chants
item.description: The FA said Wrexham's James McClean was the target of "sectarian chanting" during a match in May.

item.title: Not guilty verdict for Soldier F in Bloody Sunday murder trial
item.description: Thirteen people were shot dead and at least 15 others injured on Bloody Sunday in January 1972 at a civil rights demonstration in the Bogside area of Derry.

item.title: Why did the judge acquit Soldier F in Bloody Sunday trial?
item.description: Mr Justice Lynch said troops had "lost all sense of military discipline" but cast doubt on the level of evidence provided on who fired the shots.

item.title: Carer has to skip meals to ensure her daughter has enough food
item.description: Alicia Mehaffey says the rising cost of food means there are time she does not eat so her daughter can.

item.title: Michael McMonagle breaches sexual offences order
item.description: The former Sinn Féin press officer was jailed for child sex offences in November 2024.

item.title: NTT DATA acquires Derry-based tech firm Alchemy
item.description: The move will see Alchemy's team work on 'major transformation projects' for insurers worldwide.

item.title: Hurling star DJ Carey jailed over fake cancer claims
item.description: Former Kilkenny hurler is jailed for five-and-a-half years for defrauding people by falsely claiming he had cancer.

item.title: Man denies murdering pensioner in street robbery
item.description: Peter Augustine is accused of attacking and murdering John Mackey, 87, in Manor House on 6 May 2025.

item.title: Irish government could charge asylum seekers for accommodation
item.description: Asylum seekers who are working may be charged up to €238 (£208) per week to cover the cost of their accommodation.

item.title: President leads tributes to Irish campaigner and advocate Sister Stan
item.description: In 1985, the Kerry native founded the charity known today as Focus Ireland which supports the homeless across Ireland.

item.title: Monaghan great Hughes passes away aged 67
item.description: Monaghan icon and three-time All-Star Eugene 'Nudie' Hughes dies at the age of 67.

item.title: Man in his 20s dies following Dublin assault
item.description: A man in his 20s has been arrested and is in police custody in Dublin.

item.title: Four people die in separate crashes
item.description: Gardaí (Irish police) appeal for witnesses following four fatal crashes.

item.title: Children rescued after fire at asylum accommodation 'started deliberately'
item.description: An Garda Síochána said "this was an extremely dangerous act endangering the lives of the residents".

item.title: Man pleads guilty to manslaughter of Irish woman in New York
item.description: The district attorney said it was a murder which "shocked the community and McNally's loved ones".

item.title: What was the mysterious bright light spotted in Irish skies?
item.description: According to experts, the object was likely the debris of an Elon Musk SpaceX Falcon 9 rocket.

item.title: Two men sentenced to life for Kieran Quilligan murder
item.description: Niall Long, 33, and Luke Taylor, 27, were both found guilty of Mr Quilligan's murder last week last week.

item.title: Irish man killed in first Australian mine explosion in a decade
item.description: Ambrose McMullen, who was known as Ambie, from Cootehill, in County Cavan, is understood to have been killed at the Endeavor mine at Cobar.

item.title: Man arrested after €8m cocaine seizure
item.description: Suspected cocaine worth more than €8m (£7m) is seized by detectives in the Garda National Drugs and Organised Crime Bureau.

item.title: English tourist dies months after alleged Dublin attack
item.description: The man in his 40s was taken to Beaumont Hospital in Dublin in a critical condition in August.

item.title: Michael D Higgins returns to Áras after hospital stay
item.description: President Higgins travelled to hospital in Dublin by arrangement on Sunday and started a course of antibiotics to treat an infection.

item.title: Palestinian children arrive in Ireland for medical treatment
item.description: Seven children, along with 29 accompanying family members, arrived in Dublin on Saturday evening.

item.title: Is the end in sight for the Irish PM?
item.description: Fianna Fáil's candidate in the presidential election, Jim Gavin, withdrew several weeks ago.

item.title: Irish President Higgins congratulates his successor Connolly
item.description: Concerns have been raised about the unprecedented number of spoiled votes in the presidential poll.

item.title: Connolly declared president of Ireland after landslide win
item.description: Catherine Connolly, an independent who was backed by the major left-wing parties, pledges to be "an inclusive president for all".
